overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a practical approach focused on handling short time-series data with clear daily seasonality. It prioritizes simplicity and feasibility under constraints, opting for a heuristic averaging technique over complex models due to limited data points (96 hours) and computational limitations. The solution emphasizes pattern recognition and pragmatic implementation.
common_data_patterns: Complete data in provided window (no missing values)
key_insights: Prioritization of daily seasonality (24-hour cycles) as the dominant pattern
Rejection of complex models (SARIMA/ETS) due to limited data and implementation constraints
Use of hour-specific averaging to create a daily profile
Repetition of the averaged daily pattern for multi-day forecasting
Data rounding to match original precision (3 decimal places)
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with strong heuristic focus: Combines pattern recognition and statistical averaging while systematically evaluating and rejecting advanced models. Includes detailed data examination but simplifies implementation due to constraints.
